content:
The 100GB plan is a great starting point, and you can always adjust as needed.

Wow, that's great to hear about your phone's camera quality! Music festivals can be challenging for photography, especially in low light conditions. It's awesome that your phone's camera was able to capture great shots.

Low light photography can be tricky, but many modern smartphones have made significant improvements in this area. Did you use any specific camera modes or settings to capture those great shots? Some phones have features like night mode, pro mode, or manual mode that can help improve low-light photography.

By the way, have you considered organizing your music festival photos into albums or folders on Google Photos? It's a great way to keep your memories organized and easily accessible. You can even add captions, tags, and location information to make them more discoverable.

Google Photos also has some amazing features like automatic video creation, photo editing, and sharing capabilities. Have you explored those features yet?
